name: Bitchin' Bodies: young women talk about body dissatisfaction
description: A must-read text by author Terri L. Russ, Bitchin’ Bodies looks at young women’s stories of lived experience of body dissatisfaction. Terri charts a course for reveling in our bitchin’ bodies and starting new dialogues for satisfaction and progress. Karin Lekan’s strangely empowered heroines move through the chapters to complete this critical work on body image and community. Softcover, 272 pages, interior includes black & white images Available now. US $19.95 ISBN 978-0-9802300-1-7

name: Submerged: Tales from the Basin
description: Submerged: Tales From the Basin is an anthology of literature, memoir, and art created by more than forty women to benefit those who survived Hurricane Katrina. The title refers to a fear many of us had as young children, of having our heads submerged under water while our mothers washed our hair. The stories, essays, poems, and art of Submerged are an exploration of each contributor's relationship with her hair, in most cases emotional, often humorous, and consistently generated from youth. Artist Lorien Jordan has created a series of drawings in response to these essays, memoirs, and poems. A percentage of the book's proceeds will help support Louisiana-based charities that work with ongoing relief efforts for hurricane survivors. Meet the authors Friday, September 19 at Bristens Café. Visit our blog for details: StepSisterPress.com/blog. Softcover, interior includes black & white images September 1, 2008 US $19.95 ISBN 978-0-9802300-2-4

name: Airline to Heaven, Part I
description: The first book you need in order to address the overlapping themes of wonder cats, dead stars, and strategies for facing the end of life. This experimental collaboration features short texts and 13 color images from Annie Heckman, a series of short prose works by Matthew Dal Santo, and a short story by Terri L. Russ. It's depressing, and lighthearted at the end. To see the animation installation and works on paper that coincided with this project, visit this site. Available now. Hardcover, 64 pages, thirteen full color images. Released July 30, 2008. US $24.95 ISBN 978-0-9802300-0-0

name: artXposium 2.0: an artINcorporators project in West Chicago
description: edited by Anni Holm, Irene Pérez, and Meghan Borato artXposium 2.0 is a book chronicling the development of an annual multimedia art experience in the city of West Chicago. The book form for artXposium 2.0 began as an idea for a catalog that grew into a larger project, with essays by several participants and viewers of the 2007 exhibition, an introduction to the purpose and background of this project by Anni Holm, and images from over sixty participating artists. The launch for artXposium 2.0 coincides with a weekend-long exhibition and program of art events from September 19-21, 2008 in West Chicago, with details online at artXposium.org. Softcover, full color interior **Pre-release order** Book launches September 19, ships to pre-release orders that day. US $19.95 ISBN 978-0-9802300-3-1
